      • serializer

        public SerializerCore serializer()
        Factory method to return a configured NetworkSerializer If the "returnNew" flag is true, this method returns a new instance of NetworkSerializer and stores it for subsequent invocations of this method. If false, the previously stored NetworkSerializer is returned.
        Specified by:
        serializer in interface PersistenceAPI
        Parameters:
        config - the SerialConfig storing file storage parameters etc.
        returnNew - NetworkSerializers are expensive to instantiate so specify if the previous should be re-used or if you want a new one.
        Returns:
        a NetworkSerializer
        See Also:
        SerialConfig

      • write

        public <T extends Persistable,R> R write(T instance,
                                         java.lang.String fileName)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceAPI
        Persists the Persistable subclass to the file system using the pre-configured SerialConfig specified at the time this object was instantiated, or the default SerialConfig.
        Specified by:
        write in interface PersistenceAPI
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the stored object
        R - the type of the returned serialized form
        Parameters:
        instance - the subclass of Persistable to persist.
        fileName - the name of the file to which the object is stored.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the serialized object of type <R>

      • store

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • storeAndGet

        public <R> R storeAndGet(Network network)
        Stores the specified Network at the pre-configured location, after halting and shutting down the Network. To store the Network but keep it up and running, please see the #checkPointer() method. The Network, may however be #restart()ed after this method is called.
        Specified by:
        storeAndGet in interface PersistenceAPI
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the returned object
        Parameters:
        network - the Network to persist
        returnBytes - flag indicating whether to return the interim byte array
        Returns:
        the serialized Network in the format is either a byte[] or String (json), where byte[] is the default.

      • checkPointer

        public CheckPointOp<byte[]> checkPointer(Network network)
        Returns an rx.Observable operator that when subscribed to, invokes an operation that stores the state of this Network while keeping the Network up and running. The Network will be stored at the pre-configured location (in binary form only, not JSON).
        Specified by:
        checkPointer in interface PersistenceAPI
        Parameters:
        network - the Network to check point.
        Returns:
        the CheckPointOp operator

      • getCheckPointFunction

        <T extends Persistable,R> java.util.function.Function<T,R> getCheckPointFunction(Network network)
        Returns a Function to set on the specified network as a callback with privileged access. This Function writes the state of the specified Network to the pre-configured check point file location using the format specified in the SerialConfig specified during construction or later set on this object.
        Parameters:
        network - the Network to check point
        Returns:
        a Function which checkpoints

      • getPreviousCheckPoint

        public java.lang.String getPreviousCheckPoint(java.lang.String checkPointFileName)
        Returns the checkpointed file previous to the specified file (older), or null if one doesn't exist. The file name may be the entire filename (as configured by the SerialConfig object which establishes both the filename portion and the date portion formatting), or just the date portion of the filename.
        Specified by:
        getPreviousCheckPoint in interface PersistenceAPI
        Parameters:
        checkPointFileName - (can be entire name or just date portion)
        Returns:
        the full filename of the file checkpointed immediately previous to the file specified.

        Returns:
        the fully qualified store path

        Returns the File corresponding to "fileName" if this framework is successful in locating the specified file, otherwise it throws an IOException.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file to search for.
        Returns:
        the File if the operation is successful, otherwise an exception is thrown

      • writeFile

        void writeFile(SerialConfig config,
               byte[] bytes)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the file contained in "bytes" to disk using the SerialConfig specified which in turn specifies file name and location specifics.
        Parameters:
        config - the SerialConfig to use for file name and location
        bytes - the bytes to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the file

               byte[] bytes,
               java.nio.file.StandardOpenOption... options)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the file specified by "fileName" using the pre-configured location specified by the SerialConfig.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the file name to use
        bytes - the content to write
        options - the file handling rules to use
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem writing the file
